main event: An unidentified object was observed on radar near New Carlisle, Ohio on June 25, 1963.
interesting points: The object appeared as a bright star in the sky and disappeared twice, turned right, and disappeared twice again.
The object's movement was described as characteristic of an aircraft, but no normal explanation could be found.
The observation lasted for about 10 minutes.
The report notes that the object was not a balloon, aircraft, astronomical object, or satellite.
The witness was unable to provide any further details about the object's appearance or behavior.
sighted object: a bright star-like object in the sky
